definition: to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
the meaning of sth/an explanation of the meaning of words or phrases/definition/an interpretation (of doctrine)/religious doctrine
to dispel doubts/to clear up difficulties

sentences.english: I have a dog named Olay, it's a Shih Tzu breed.
sentences.chinese: 我有一只狗叫的玉兰油，这是一个释慈济的品种。

sentences.english: Example:1. If that be so, we shall take action at once.
sentences.chinese: 如果情况释那样，我们就立刻采取行动。

sentences.english: China-Japan tea culture has been seeped through with three schools of thought—Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 中日茶文化都渗透了儒道释三家思想。

sentences.english: Chapter IV analyzes the founding way and regulatory system of the judge' s power of legal interpretation in China.
sentences.chinese: 第四章分析了我国法官释法权的构建途径和规制。

sentences.english: I am also aware that Ms. Hedegaard has made an explanation over that.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到赫泽高女士自己已作出相识释。

sentences.english: Therefore, Judge' s power of legal interpretation is the inherent needs for the legal application.
sentences.chinese: 所以，法官释法权是法律适用的内在需要。

sentences.english: The authority of Scripture is undermined in hermeneutics. (Cf.
sentences.chinese: 《圣经》的权威在释经学圈子里不受尊重。

definition: to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
Hào Rán (1932-2008), journalist and proletarian novelist
abbr. for 梵教[Fan4 jiao4] Brahmanism/abbr. for Sanskrit 梵語|梵语[Fan4 yu3] or 梵文[Fan4 wen2]/abbr. for 梵蒂岡|梵蒂冈[Fan4 di4 gang1], the Vatican
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
to admonish/to warn sb of their errors/to criticize frankly/Taiwan pr. [zheng1]
